text: Infantile respiratory distress syndrome (IRDS), also called respiratory distress syndrome of newborn, or increasingly surfactant deficiency disorder (SDD), and previously called hyaline membrane disease (HMD), is a syndrome in premature infants caused by developmental insufficiency of pulmonary surfactant production and structural immaturity in the lungs. IRDS affects about 1% of newborns and is the leading cause of death in preterm infants. ==References== Category:Medical emergencies
title: Infant respiratory distress syndrome
